title.rendered: Experience the best of the best in professional rodeo action this weekend at the Silver Spurs Arena

content.rendered:
The RAM National Circuit Finals Rodeo returns to Osceola County Silver Spurs Arena this weekend, with the best of the best in rodeo competition. Rodeo Fans will see 200+ circuit champions from across the US and Canada vie for $1 million in cash and prizes while trying to leave their mark on history. Plus, local vendors will be on-site for shopping and selling local merchandise.

“With the RAM National Circuit Finals Rodeo being in Osceola County for several years, we are building on and growing an amazing, one-of-a-kind rodeo that brings national champions and fans all under one roof,” said Brandon Arrington, Chair of the Osceola County Commission. “The final round on Saturday night, including some local cowboys and cowgirls, will have you on the edge of your seat as the best of the best compete against each other for $1 million in cash and prizes.”

On Thursday, April 8th at 7:30 pm the RNCFR will show its heart for the community on Healthcare Heroes Night (Invitation Only). All healthcare employees will receive complimentary tickets with a valid ID. (One per ID. Capacity is limited. First come, first serve)

Friday night, April 9th at 7:30 p.m. the Silver Spurs Arena will light up for our local active and retired military and first responders. It’s Military Appreciation Night! Free admission with a valid ID. (One per ID)

On Saturday, April 10th at 1:30 p.m. it’s Family Day. If you’re looking for fun for the entire family, this is a rodeo for you. Grab your boots and enjoy good food and good family fun!

Saturday night at 7:30 p.m. is Pink Heals Night – Wear your best “pink” and honor those who are fighting and have fought cancer. A $1,000 donation will be made to the Pink Heals Organization of St. Cloud, Florida. Staff, competitors, and livestock will be sporting their pink rodeo gear! Plus, this is the Final Round of the RAM NCFR, where the top eight contestants from each event advance to the semifinal round, then move to sudden death competition that determines the National Champions in each event.

It all takes place at Silver Spurs Rodeo Arena at Osceola Heritage Park – 1875 Silver Spur Lane, Kissimmee, FL 34744.

Tickets range from $25 – $85 for adults, kids 3 – 12 range from $12.50 – $15 for each performance, and kids 2 and under are free. Seniors 55+ may receive $3.00 off any ticket purchase (with valid ID). On April 8th & 9th, during Healthcare Heroes and Military Appreciation Night, we will honor healthcare employees, servicemen and women, and first responders with free admission (with valid ID). Tickets can be purchased at the Silver Spurs Arena Box Office, by phone at 800-745-3000, or by visiting ​www.Ticketmaster.com​.

For detailed and up-to-date information, please visit ​www.RFD-TV.com.
